Pet flea treatments are poisoning English rivers with toxic pesticides.

We are calling for the government to ban the use of fipronil and imidacloprid as flea treatments.
#NoInsectinction

https://t.co/3n7On0w2VS

tweets.text: Work to improve flood defences in #Fishlake, #Doncaster which was badly hit by the November 2019 floods, started last month. Here's area flood risk manager Helen Batt talking about work which will make #flood defences in the area more resilient. https://t.co/Zqt4pI1Jx1 https://t.co/ciiPakfoEq
Good to join @floodinnovation this morning to talk about our ambitions on Property Flood Resilience in the @EnvAgency Flood & Coastal Erosion  strategy #PFR https://t.co/ZyTE8f6DOP

TODAY in our Property Flood Resilience workshop we'll be exploring #flooding and #PFR policy - looking forward to meeting our attendees, see you at 9:30! #FIC #FloodInnovation #InnovationSupport https://t.co/hK7CiESoRE

@guardiannews This is shocking! ‚ÄúOne flea treatment of a medium-sized dog with imidacloprid contains enough pesticide to kill 60 million bees‚Äù Prof D Coulson. @unisurreyalerts @BritishVets  @EnvAgency @Buzz_dont_tweet

tweets.text:
We need to demolish Shade Chapel to open up the culvert beneath it to help reduce the flood risk for people in Todmorden. 

Part of Rochdale Road will be closed from 8pm on Fri 27 Nov until 6am Mon 30 Nov so that the work can be carried out safely.

https://t.co/j8x6wTIfoD https://t.co/NsQltBv5y8
It's worth noting this business received ¬£214,430 in farm subsidies last year & ¬£95689 the previous year. Plus all the tax breaks. https://t.co/6piUtVOZDG

We are working with @wiltscouncil on some big plans for #Salisbury. Have your say about #SalisburyRiverPark, a project that aims to reduce flood risk, improve environmental opportunities and create green spaces #LocalGrowthFund @SWLEP @SalisburyCC   https://t.co/hBUHsaNJw4 https://t.co/GxgJAqUapO

The #Ineson2020 Lecture is going virtual!! Save the date: 26th November 4pm-5:30pm. This years lecture, joint with @Geolsoc_hydro& @IAH_Ireland will be delivered by Anne Dacey, DD for Water @EnvAgency, discussing the future of UK #groundwater post-2020. More info to follow soon! https://t.co/wjZHfWZaQu

tweets.text: Apologies, change of plan, we‚Äôre at #Chiswell #Dorset tomorrow testing the flood sirens. Our annual test to make sure they are working to warn the local community that #flooding is imminent. Listen out at 10am and 1pm tomorrow thank you #Floodaware

Just received this from @EnvAgency

"...current levels of abstraction are causing environmental damage. Any increase in use WITHIN EXISTING LICENSED VOLUMES will increase the pressure on a system that is already failing environmental targets." 

Thread 1/2 https://t.co/1mnOuVTXt7

for how much development to plan for, and where development should be. This is scheduled for full public consultation in 2021. In the meantime, we have published the initial studies online at  so that they can be read by anyone interested in how the Local Plan is being developed.

tweets.text:
Quite the before and after....

#TeamEA have been out in parts of the North West, like here in Belle Vale, #Liverpool clearing grids of leaves & debris following heavy rainfall.

More rain is expected this week, keep following @metoffice for the latest forecast üå®Ô∏è https://t.co/MeFoG44AfS

As @UKLabour's Shadow Flooding Minister, I met with @JamesBevanEA, the Chief Exec of the @EnvAgency. 

We discussed their Flood Management strategy and what the Environment Agency is doing to improve and repair flood defences to protect areas like Barnsley from floods this winter

River Keekle Video
Interested in the history behind the plastic lined River Keekle and the restoration programme? Watch the International River Symposium video here:
https://t.co/u0ar5Zdfa5
@WestCumbriaRT @EnvAgencyNW @SalfordScience @SalfordHydro https://t.co/BaFbl5Uqwz

Would you know what to do in the event of a flood? 

5.2 million homes and businesses in England are at risk of flooding. Don't assume it won't happen to you. Find out how you can #PrepareActSurvive üëá

https://t.co/a9sZgdRGHP

#FloodActionWeek https://t.co/WrdSzNfPqb

@ACarpenDigital @Sam_in_Cam @paulfrainer @AnglianWater This report is inaccurate.

It contradicts the letter I received from the @EnvAgency back in August.

We cannot accommodate ANY further growth without new infrastructure.

https://t.co/gLnpwdeb8N

There are several flood warnings and alerts in place across the South East...

You can check your flood risk and keep up with the latest situation at: https://t.co/64gyL62UXF

You can also register for our free flood warning service by calling: 0345 988 1188

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/cFUeJnAYvZ

The latest river level for Cookham Lock is 19cm and rising. @EnvAgencySE tends to call a Flood Alert at 20cm. We can keep up to date by registering for flood alerts by text, phone or email. Latest Cookham flood info. at Cookham Flood Warnings blogspot https://t.co/BDBUl8Nt2A
They should stand up and be counted. And where are @EnvAgency in all of this? "It's our job to look after your environment and create better places for people and wildlife." https://t.co/TCfxg86Gso
